intro: Olyra wurdackii, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Olyra wurdackii is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands. Its ecological role includes providing forage for livestock and serving as a habitat for various invertebrates.
